keyword: how many calories is in a ear of corn
title: How Many Calories in an Ear of Corn?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in a ear of corn, including carbs, protein, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with easy tweaks.
h1: How Many Calories in an Ear of Corn?
assumptions: Medium ear of yellow sweet corn (~100 g kernels), boiled or steamed, no added butter, salt, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by corn variety, size, freshness, cooking method, and additions like butter; check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium ear of corn provides ~90 kcal and ~19 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Grilled with light oil spray (vs. boiled)
Small ear (~80 g kernels) instead of medium

faqs.q: How many calories is in a ear of corn?
faqs.a: About 90 kcal for one medium ear of boiled sweet corn.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in an ear of corn?
faqs.a: Roughly 19 g total carbs, including 2.7 g fiber and 6.3 g sugars.
Modest at ~3.3 g protein per medium ear; it's more carb-focused.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in corn?
faqs.a: Boiling or steaming keeps it low; grilling or frying with oil adds calories.

faqs.q: What about sodium in an ear of corn?
faqs.a: Naturally low (~15 mg); salting during cooking increases it significantly.
